Ingredients:
1. ¼ cup of olive oil, 1 onion chopped, 2 carrots chopped, 4 garlic clove minced 2. 1 tsp curry powder & ½ tsp dried thyme,1 large can diced tomatoes 3. 1 cup brown or green lentils, 4 cups vegetable broth, 2 cups water, 1 tsp salt 4. Pinch of red pepper flakes, black pepper, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Recipe:
1. Warm the olive oil in pot, add the chopped onion and carrot and cook, 5 mins 2. Add the curry powder and thyme. Stir. Pour in the drained diced tomatoes and cook 3. Pour in the lentils and the water. Add 1 tsp salt & red pepper flakes with black pepper and cook 30 mins 4. Transfer 2 cups of the soup to a blender. and purée the soup until smooth. Pour the puréed soup back into the pot. 5. Add the chopped greens and cook for 5 more minutes, stir in 1 tbsp of lemon juice and serve

Ingredients:
1. 1 large ripe avocado, 1 lime, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1 red onion 2. 2 medium sweet potatoes , 2 large eggs, sriracha , for drizzling
Recipe:
1. Smash up the avocado with a fork, then add the lime juice and season to taste. 2. Heat the oil in a large, non-stick frying pan over a medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 2 mins 3. then stir in the sweet potato. Season and press the potato into the pan with the back of a wooden spoon. Cook for 10-15 mins, until golden. 4. Make two spaces in the pan, crack in the eggs and cook for 2-3 mins until the whites are just set and the yolks runny. Add the avocado and drizzle with sriracha to serve.

Ingredients:
1. 2 toasted pita - torn into bitesize. 2 tbsp extra-virgin olive oil, pinch of sea salt 2. ½ batch fresh mint dressing, fresh romaine lettuce, chopped, 1 large tomato, chopped, 3. 1 cup quartered of cucumber, 1 chopped red onion, ½ cup torn fresh mint leaves
Recipe:
1. Toast the pita in your oven for 8-12 minutes until golden and crispy 2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, mint and toasted pita. 3. drizzle up to ½ cup dressing over the salad. Gently toss until all of the ingredients are lightly coated in dressing. Serve promptly.

Ingredients:
1. 400g can chickpeas, 100ml lemon juice, 150ml olive oil, 125g tahini 2. 1 ½ tsp ground coriander, 5 cardamom pods, toasted pine nuts, sumac
Recipe:
1. Drain the can of chickpeas, keeping the water. Gently warm in a microwave, then tip into a food processor with the lemon juice, olive oil, tahini, ground coriander and crushed seeds from the cardamom pods. 2. Blend until smooth – add a splash of chickpea water if it's looking a little dry. Check the seasoning and add more oil and lemon juice to taste. Serve sprinkled with toasted pine nuts and sumac.

Ingredients:
1. ½ x 200g pack melon medley, 150g pot fat-free yogurt, 2 tbsp fruit & fibre cereal, 1 tbsp mixed seed, 1 tsp clear honey
Recipes:
1. Top melon medley with yogurt, then sprinkle over cereal mixed with seeds. Drizzle over honey and eat immediately.
